item.title: Norco studio announces android investigation adventure Silenus with "experimental" demo
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/norco-studio-announces-android-investigation-adventure-silenus-with-experimental-demo

If you click on a link and make a purchase we may receive a small commission. Read our editorial policy.

But it's only available until June.

Geography of Robots - the developer behind 2022's acclaimed narrative adventure Norco - has revealed its new project, Silenus, and there's an "experimental" Steam demo to try right now.

Silenus is described as a "micro-adventure" - lasting 2-2.5 hours - set on a Gulf Flow oil refinery recently acquired by Rubens Link, an "enigmatic company with an unclear agenda". Cast as an android called Titian, players must investigate the company's true motives - which seems to go beyond installing automation tech as it claims - by solving puzzles, deciphering clues, conversing with characters, and poking around the remains of vanished workers.

The newly released demo version of Silenus is officially known as the Umbilical Pre-Release demo, and it's been created in collaboration with Baton Rouge doom metal band Thou to help promote its new album. "Thou composed material for our 2022 release Norco," Geography of Robots explains in an FAQ accompanying the demo, "and we decided to extend this collaboration to help draw attention to their upcoming album release Umbilical."

A demo of our short adventure game Silenus is OUT NOW on Steam. Investigate a refinery operated by an obscure organization. Unlock all tracks from Thou's upcoming album Umbilical. This is a very small taste with more to come, so be sure to wishlist! üîó below. pic.twitter.com/oyymxEXfWw

‚Äî geographyofrobots (@roboticgeo) May 20, 2024

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

In the portion of Silenus available in the demo, players can unlock and listen to all the tracks from Umbilical, but the studio notes the game itself is "likely to change [a lot]" between now and release. "Many elements of the demo were designed with the Umbilical listening feature in mind," it explains. "These will likely be removed or reworked. Some narrative details will remain the same while others will change. However, the overall themes, aesthetics, and gameplay will be largely the same."

Silenus' demo is compatible with Mac, Steam Deck, and controllers but is only available for a limited time. Thou's album launches on 31st May, and Geography of Robots plans to keep the demo available "for 2 - 3 weeks following this release."

The developer say it hopes to complete the full version of Silenus "by the end of 2024". And if you've yet to experience the studio's previous project, Norco - which Eurogamer's Chris Tapsell called a "beautiful, surprising, human, and utterly magnetic debut" in his Recommended review - it's currently discounted by 60 percent on Steam.

item.title: I Saw the TV Glow is a powerful call to action ‚Äî any action
item.content:encoded:
https://www.polygon.com/24160895/i-saw-the-tv-glow-ending-explained-interpretation

I Saw the TV Glow has the kind of ending that sends people running to the internet looking for explainers and conversation ‚Äî not because they didn‚Äôt understand it, exactly, but because they don‚Äôt necessarily believe what they just saw. Jane Schoenbrun‚Äôs follow-up to 2022‚Äôs We‚Äôre All Going to the World‚Äôs Fair is a dark movie: dark in the visuals, since so much of it takes place in queasy late-night spaces and dim, muddy interiors, and dark in the narrative specifics, which are not designed to comfort or coddle the viewers. This is not a feel-good film with a pat, heartwarming ending.

But it is a film that seems designed to get under viewers‚Äô skins, and leave them examining their lives and their choices. Schoenbrun invites people to take any lingering discomfort that comes out of the end of the movie, and go do something with it. It‚Äôs a call to action, though what exactly ‚Äúaction‚Äù means is left wide open. Schoenbrun has a specific intention in mind, but the metaphor here is also broad enough that anyone watching this movie can wrap it tightly around their own lives and their own bodies until it fits for them.

[Ed. note: End spoilers ahead for I Saw the TV Glow.]

The movie follows many years in the life of Owen (Ian Foreman in his younger years, Justice Smith thereafter), a hesitant, socially awkward kid who clearly struggles to relate to other people, at school and at home. When he meets hostile, disconnected Maddy (Brigette Lundy-Paine), he manages a tentative connection with her by sharing her fandom for a late-night TV show about teenagers Isabel and Tara, who fight the world‚Äôs darkest, most evil forces with their powerful psychic connection. (The show, The Pink Opaque, was inspired in part by Schoenbrun‚Äôs childhood obsession with Buffy the Vampire Slayer.)

Eventually, Maddy runs away from home and disappears without a trace, while Owen trudges from high school to early adulthood without shedding any of his adolescent awkwardness. Maddy returns eight years later to tell him she‚Äôs been inside the show ‚Äî from her perspective, Owen and Maddy are Isabel and Tara in The Pink Opaque, but they were captured by their enemies and buried alive, their hearts cut out and stuffed in a refrigerator.

Maddy says she escaped and rediscovered her true identity as Tara, but back in the real world, where time runs differently, Isabel is still buried, and the vision she‚Äôs been forced into ‚Äî the false identity as Owen ‚Äî will soon end when they both die. Maddy wants Owen to accept this, and go through the dangerous, deadly-sounding ritual she endured to wake herself up.

For viewers, Maddy‚Äôs version of reality is likely to sound much more compelling than Owen‚Äôs. It‚Äôs a classic escapist fantasy: ‚ÄúThis boring life we‚Äôre living isn‚Äôt real. We‚Äôre actually heroes from another world, with superpowers, and a mission to save the world.‚Äù But the route to get there is so dark and frightening ‚Äî Maddy literally wants Owen to let her seal him in a coffin and bury him alive ‚Äî that he rejects it and resists her. And that‚Äôs understandable, too. Maddy‚Äôs story could also be interpreted as a dangerous, paranoid delusion, and her solution sounds potentially fatal. Schoenbrun doesn‚Äôt pull punches about this particular call to adventure: There‚Äôs no clear evidence that Maddy isn‚Äôt unintentionally luring Owen into joint suicide. There‚Äôs no overt evidence that anything she‚Äôs saying is true.

Schoenbrun has been clear about seeing all of this as a trans coming-out story. Within the Pink Opaque narrative, Owen‚Äôs authentic self is female. He has periodic visions or dreams, quick flashes where he‚Äôs in the Pink Opaque setting as himself, but wearing Isabel‚Äôs dress. Maddy wants to take him on a journey to find his real body and his true identity as Isabel, but the path to get there will be painful and take real commitment.

Owen recoils from it, refuses to accept Maddy‚Äôs revelations, and chooses to stay in his old life. Even though the Pink Opaque narrative haunts him, he takes the passive route, muddling through his existing life and claiming that it‚Äôs gratifying, that he‚Äôs found peace, family, and contentment there.

Ahead of the movie‚Äôs wide release, Schoenbrun talked to Polygon about that kind of passivity, and about feeling it‚Äôs a familiar part of the trans experience:

I think that kind of ‚Äúpassivity‚Äù feels inherently tied to an experience that I ‚Äî and I think many other trans folks ‚Äî can relate to on a deeply visceral level. It indicates exactly how our ideas about what proper narrative or progress is is not only woefully limited in the experiences it‚Äôs showing, but also like maybe by definition, masculine and cis. [It‚Äôs] reflective of an idea of agency and individual agency that doesn‚Äôt resonate with other experiences, like my own. And so I am trying to rewrite or call into question or challenge or simply just like, exist within alternative ideas of narrative structure, to express something that feels emotionally truthful to my experience in the world.

Schoenbrun clearly feels sympathy for Owen‚Äôs dilemma, and for his uncertainty about redefining himself as someone else. At the same time, though, the director repeatedly suggests that Owen is lying to himself. While he defends himself to the audience by saying he built a family of his own and that he loves them, we never see them or hear any details about them. They never seem real, and even their existence might be a hallucination or an outright lie. As Owen continues to reject Maddy‚Äôs version of the truth, years blur by for him, with no sense of grounding or connection in the reality he‚Äôs chosen.

Toward the end of the movie, he‚Äôs clearly stuck in an unsatisfying place in life, surrounded by unpleasant people and working at an unfulfilling job. In two of the movie‚Äôs most vividly painful moments, he screams that he‚Äôs dying and he pleads for help, but no one around him hears him or sees his distress. Then he cuts his own chest open, and sees the staticky glow of the TV screen inside. As Schoenbrun explained it to Entertainment Weekly:

After half a lifetime of resistance, when Owen finally sees that glow inside himself ‚Äî and to do so, he literally has to open himself up and see the heart that‚Äôs been taken from him, and see that it‚Äôs been replaced by this signal that could be something beautiful, but also carries the ambivalence and sinister nature of the emptiness of glow; the thing that it is representing what isn‚Äôt there inside him. This was my attempt to capture the ambivalence and overwhelming joy and possibility, but also things that feel sinister and terrifying about an egg crack ‚Äî the moment when, as a queer or trans person, you understand that you aren‚Äôt yourself and that you need to become something else to conjure that magic that was maybe there in childhood and maybe there in these other moments in life.

Even faced with this visible, obvious sign that his chosen mundane reality has cracks in it, though, Owen still doesn‚Äôt take that next step. He closes up his chest and goes back to his work in a shrill, dark, oppressive arcade ‚Äî and he humbly apologizes to everyone he encounters, embarrassed about that outburst that no one else saw, remembers, or cares about.

It‚Äôs a horrifying sequence: He‚Äôs living out a series of intense private agonies and doubts, and instead of giving those doubts space, he‚Äôs muffling them for the sake of all the utterly indifferent people around him. Instead of examining the source of his terror and trying to find a solution, he begs for forgiveness from absolute strangers, out of anxiety that his impending death might have impinged on their fun. It‚Äôs hard to say which is more horrifying: his humility and humiliation, or everyone else‚Äôs apathy and inability to even see his pain.

It‚Äôs a dark, sad ending ‚Äî there is no rescue coming for Owen, no sudden breakthrough where Maddy saves him in spite of himself, or where the world of The Pink Opaque sends him even clearer proof that he‚Äôs on the wrong track and needs to reverse course. The message is clear enough: No one can force Owen to find his own identity or his own satisfaction in life. No one can make his choices for him, or tell him who he really is.

But while the ending is heavy and painful for Owen ‚Äî and, if we accept Maddy‚Äôs version of events, for Isabel ‚Äî it has a clear purpose beyond scaring, startling, and saddening viewers. It‚Äôs a reminder that not making choices is a form of choice ‚Äî one we have to live with, one that has consequences. It‚Äôs a vibrant call to action, and a warning about how passivity and fear can be their own kind of living death. Watching Owen ‚Äúdecay,‚Äù as Schoenbrun puts it, is tragic and alarming ‚Äî and seemingly meant to show viewers the repercussions of holding still in their lives, of refusing to confront or examine their own questions about themselves. Owen isn‚Äôt a classic hero, he‚Äôs a cautionary tale about self-repression.

Does that mean The Pink Opaque is real, Isabel is real, Owen is trans, and there‚Äôs only one possible way forward for him that doesn‚Äôt lead to suffocation and death? Not necessarily. Schoenbrun doesn‚Äôt leave him another obvious way out of his oppressive life, but given that he never seems to seek one, or to discuss his feelings of unreality and emptiness with anyone but Maddy, it seems that his inertia and willingness to live in apologetic misery are the problems, not just his refusal to be buried alive. He‚Äôs afraid to even explore his feelings with Maddy herself, both as a young man and an old one. He finds it safer to be stuck ‚Äî and to be baffled, sad, and lonely ‚Äî than to take action. And Schoenbrun shows us all the consequences of that decision.

That metaphor certainly isn‚Äôt limited to coming out as queer, or trans. Schoenbrun is reflecting a personal experience and a personal feeling, one that some trans viewers certainly identify with. But Owen‚Äôs withering, shrinking life is a memorable image for anyone facing similar questions about who they are, who they want to be, and whether they can find a way to that future by exploring their options and choosing change. His story doesn‚Äôt ever find a happy ending. But it‚Äôs an emotional, heartfelt plea to anyone watching I Saw the TV Glow to go do the frightening work of seeking out one for themselves.

item.title: Call Of Duty‚Äôs Next Crossover Brings Gundam To The Game
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/call-of-duty-warzone-gundam-crossover-1851489124

Each season of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare III and free-to-play battle royale Warzone includes crossovers with other pop-culture franchises. The games have seen King Kong, Dune, and more in past seasons. None of them have been that enticing to me, but then again I‚Äôm not the audience since I don‚Äôt play CoD. Hold on, I‚Äôm being handed a note‚Ä¶HOLY SHIT, guys they are doing a Gundam crossover! I guess I‚Äôm a CoD player now.

Why This Gundam Anime Is Perfect For Newcomers And OGs Alike

  • Off
  • English

Mobile Suit Gundam is a massive multi-media franchise about science fiction warfare waged using giant mecha. The franchise began in 1979 with the original Mobile Suit Gundam animated series but has spanned multiple shows, movies, manga, video games, and more in the decades since. Now that long list includes a CoD crossover.

The Gundam crossover will debut in Season 4 of MW3/Warzone, as revealed in a tease on social media followed by a full announcement on May 20. Season 4 begins on May 29 but there are no concrete details on when the Gundam bundles will become available in game. When they do arrive, they will come in the form of three special packs. Combined, the packs give players access to Operator Skins for three iconic suits from the franchise: the RX-78-2, MS-06S Zaku II, and XVX-016 Gundam Aerial. It‚Äôs a nice collection of old and new models from the franchise, but I think they should‚Äôve gone wild and made an Operator Skin for iconic antagonist Char Aznable. He‚Äôs just a guy in a funny outfit and I want to see him go wild with a machine gun.

The packs will also include special death effects, emblems, charms, decals, and more goodies. No word on pricing yet, but expect it to be in line with past crossover bundles which have cost 2400 COD Points each, which is the equivalent of $20 in real money. For those who don‚Äôt purchase the bundles, Season 4 will also have a Gundam-themed event, which also currently has no release date. Don‚Äôt be surprised if there is also a special item you‚Äôll get for buying all the packs, as was the case with both the King Kong and Dune bundles.

I just love the idea of running around a fairly realistic military shooter as a giant robot with colorful paint and a laser sword. The Gundams won‚Äôt be as big as they are in the franchise traditionally, which kind of makes it even funnier. It just adds to the absurdity of Warzone‚Äôs skins, which makes it feel like a cosplay event where Timoth√©e Chalamet can get wrecked by a robot or Nicki Minaj. Also, ever since the excellent hero-shooter Gundam Evolution was shut down in November of 2023, this may be the closest thing.

item.title: Microsoft Is Bringing Copilot AI To Video Games
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/microsoft-is-bringing-copilot-ai-to-video-games/

Microsoft held its major Surface and AI event on Monday. While it wasn‚Äôt livestreamed for people to watch, there is information coming out that pertains to Microsoft‚Äôs Copilot and video games.

Microsoft revealed that it will begin working to add Copilot directly into its games. The game shown as an example was Minecraft that will let players use AI to ask if you have the right materials to craft an item. In this instance, the item was a sword.

Copilot then searches the inventory for the materials and tells you if you can make your sword or not.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôve got some sticks, perfect for the sword‚Äôs handle,‚Äù the Copilot said. ‚ÄúBut it looks like you‚Äôre missing the material for the blade. You can use wood, stone, iron, gold, or diamond.‚Äù

While it‚Äôs unknown when these features will be added to games like Minecraft or what other games will take advantage of the ability, it‚Äôs clear that Microsoft has its sight set on guides and tutorials for gamers. This implementation could go a long way in making the ways of looking up walkthroughs a thing of the past.

How much it‚Äôll be adopted, however, we‚Äôll have to wait and see.

item.title: What a community-led shift to independent fan wikis means for game developers
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamedeveloper.com/marketing/what-a-community-led-shift-to-independent-fan-wikis-means-for-game-developers

Since the game industry‚Äôs early days, players have long relied on guides to help them progress in their favorite games. Developers do everything possible to deliver the needed information in a game itself, but many players inevitably turn to third-party resources. Publishers like Penguin Random House subsidiary Prima Games sold game guides sometimes in collaboration with the developers themselves.

The company couldn‚Äôt overcome the growth of the online guides ecosystem, which has grown from the player-created guides of GameFAQs to a host of websites and wikis answering every possible question a player might need after a quick Google search. It folded in 2018.

But online guides are beginning to eat themselves alive too. Content farms with loose plagiarism policies have gamed search engine optimization methods to supersede reliable sites in the search results of platforms like Google. Some use sponsored listings to make money, not reliability, as the means of attracting advertising eyeballs.

Even worse, some turn to generative AI tools to just spam seemingly useful information, accuracy be damned.

The degrading resources are beginning to have an impact on game communities. Some‚Äîlike the organizers of the Hollow Knight Wiki hosted on Fandom‚Äîare taking dramatic steps to preserve these vital player-led resources. It‚Äôs a noteworthy shift that could change the future of video game communities, and how developers interact with them.

What is driving players to form independent wikis?

Fandom hosts more than a quarter million Wikis, which are walkthroughs or guides to help players get through or get the most out of games. Because of its size, it holds a large amount of influence over pop culture and is often first in a google search for the given game or property.

Wikis, also known as FAQs, are public pages, fully editable by anyone with an account. As Maws, a wiki writer, put it, ‚ÄúIf I write a section for Dream Nail (an ability in Hollow Knight‚Äôs wiki page) I‚Äôm not entitled to it. Anyone could walk in, wipe the slate, and write something better than that afterwards.‚Äù

It‚Äôs a communal process that ensures a competent end result, but like many passion projects that garner enough attention, the site the wiki writers had spent so much time on changed irrevocably when it was bought up by a private equity firm.

Fandom was first formed as Wikicities in 2004, and took on its current name in 2016 after being acquired by former AOL CEO Jon Miller, backed by private equity firm TPG Capital.

The for-profit model under private equity led to some very unpopular decisions for many community creators. Some, like the organizers of the Terraria, Legend of Zelda, Fallout and Minecraft wikis left the platform and changed domains.

After TPG Capital took over, the Hollow Knight wiki contributors saw their wiki‚Äôs quality decline as new restrictions were put in place, limiting their ability to fix issues the site itself was creating. ‚ÄúWe tolerated it for so long because initially there was listening and feedback,‚Äù said ‚ÄúZigmatism,‚Äù a wiki writer for the Hollow Knight community who asked to be referred to by their nickname.

‚ÄúBefore all of this, [Fandom] was *the* place for hosting a wiki if you didn‚Äôt have the resources to go independent.‚Äù

Many community editors decamped from the site after the unusually-named ‚ÄúThe Grimace Incident‚Äù where Fandom removed an entire community-generated page on McDonald‚Äôs B-tier mascot Grimace and replaced it with an ad for its Grimace-themed milkshake, ‚Äúthe Grimace Shake,‚Äù which had a brief viral moment in 2023.

Image via Fandom.

‚ÄúI can add [the content] back, but what‚Äôs the point if they‚Äôre paying a dude to undo it?‚Äù contributor Nathan Steinmetz said on X (formerly Twitter). His work had been wiped away by the advertising campaign. ‚ÄúIt sets a bad precedent when any IP holder can approach Fandom and have user content suppressed and released with an ad.‚Äù

The Hollow Knight wiki editors departed after an AI invasion

Eventually, the Hollow Knight community decided to join the exodus. Their complaints included a poor user interface and aggressive ads. In a post titled ‚ÄúMoving from Fandom,‚Äù the Hollow Knight contributors stated that the last straw was the ‚ÄúQuick Answers‚Äù feature, which used generative AI to ask and answer user questions. The tool was reportedly full of grammatical errors and pulled answers from unrelated pages. Community editors were initially unable to edit or remove the tool if they so desired.

The feature was pulled within 24 hours due to the backlash and is now optional for editors to use, instead of mandatory. But the damage was done.

Youtube creator Mossbag spotlighted the turmoil in his video, ‚ÄúStop Using Fandom,‚Äù documenting that readers would be interrupted by links to articles from Fandom sibling organizations GameSpot and ScreenJunkies and be asked to take part in surveys, ‚Äúcreating a distracting, frustrating and slow experience for editors and readers alike.‚Äù

Zigmatism was sour on how companies like Fandom intend to use AI tools, saying they seemed designed to replace artists and writers instead of automating backbreaking labor.

Maws noted that it‚Äôs the reason for Quick Answers that bothers him: ‚Äú(It was created) for Fandom to get additional revenue. It‚Äôs not just that the human element in ‚Äúwriting‚Äù is erased. It‚Äôs seemingly as if the only human element is from the guy who turns that feature on, and that‚Äôs that.‚Äù

‚ÄúForking away‚Äù from Fandom

With all this going on, it's no surprise that many communities would want to "fork away" from Fandom, migrating all their work to alternate platforms. In the aforementioned explanatory post, the Hollow Knight contributors wrote that they felt very little control over the content they created, stating, "Fandom does not care about the effort put into content, and will erase hours of work without a second thought."

The situation has improved, ‚Äúraising the satisfaction level to what it should be,‚Äù according to Zigmatism, who also noted that would not have been possible without the immediate outrage and the threat to the company‚Äôs bottom line.

‚ÄúI know [after multiple Wikis branched], Fandom went into a kind of all-hands-on-deck mode, listening to [and polling] editors and making some good changes overall,‚Äù he said. But he still believes independent, fan-hosted wikis are a better fit for developers looking to get involved, which tend to be a little more flexible and less profit-oriented.

Image via Team Cherry.

Any time a passionate group working on a project gains enough traction, there‚Äôs the possibility of it being bought up or monetized. That, in turn, carries the risk of degrading whatever made the original special, and in worst-case scenarios, key parts can get chopped off to be sold later.

"I love archiving knowledge, and I love promoting people's hard work," Zigmatism said, when discussing the new Hollow Knight wiki. "Wikis are a perfect mix of those two drives."  "You can tell people actually care about what they're doing in (the new Hollow Knight) Wiki," added Maws.

There‚Äôs good reason for developers to be aware of this growing shift. Josh Zimmerman, a professor and community engagement consultant from the University of Arizona, explained to Game Developer via email that accurate, well-functioning, fan-hosted Wikis reinforce player loyalty in games through what he described as ‚Äúfannish performance.‚Äù

He added that such projects can also serve as archives for games no longer in circulation or who are not playable in their original states thanks to years of bugfixes and content additions.

The experience of poor wiki tech on larger sites may drive away fans who are otherwise passionate about learning the intricacies of a game. Given the depth of work that goes into chronicling the ins and outs of a title, developers should be aware that players are becoming so frustrated they jump ship for a homebrewed platform.

It could get worse. If maintaining fan wikis becomes too arduous, fans might abandon the communities around their favorite games entirely.

item.content:encoded:
https://www.destructoid.com/mw3-season-4-early-patch-notes-new-maps-modes-killstreaks-and-equipment-items/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=mw3-season-4-early-patch-notes-new-maps-modes-killstreaks-and-equipment-items

Modern Warfare 3 players have plenty to be excited about for the upcoming season, as the update introduces new maps, modes, killstreaks, and equipment items. Here is everything you need to know about Season 4.

Sledgehammer Games has consistently delivered a healthy dose of content for each seasonal update. After launching with 20 6v6 maps in November 2023, that count is now up to 33, with three more coming throughout Season 4. On top of that, a consistent offering of new game modes, events, and features makes it a great time to be a multiplayer fan. Season 4 is no different, as the devs offer up a package that will give players plenty to sink their teeth into.

MW3 Season 4 patch notes

Two new 6v6 maps

  • Tokyo: Experience Tokyo nightlife in this mid-sized Multiplayer map featuring late night shopping, entertainment, and accommodations for the weary traveler. Battle for the map‚Äôs major power positions, the Hotel and Manga buildings facing one another over the main road. Except for these two locations, the fight stays on ground level.
  • Paris: Head to the City of Lights for a rendezvous with the enemy, fighting across this mid-sized map dominated by the central Police Station and Gallery. Navigate the surrounding streets to remain on ground level or take the battle to either of the two main buildings. Don‚Äôt underestimate the map‚Äôs smaller interior spaces, the Bookstore and Shop. These areas provide overhead cover in a pinch and are generally less conspicuous than the large center buildings.

Season 4 new game modes

  • Demolition: One of the finest tactical game modes in Call of Duty is finally back! Appearing for the first time since Season 3 of Modern Warfare (2019) this round-based objective mode has similarities to Search & Destroy, with teams alternating between attacking and defending two bomb sites. However, unlike S&D, respawns are enabled and attacking players always spawn with a bomb, and defuses ‚Äì ninja or otherwise ‚Äì don‚Äôt end the round. This leads to highly tactical engagements ‚Äì and pandemonium ‚Äì as teams converge on bomb sites and pressure the opposition. 
  • Hyper Cranked: This twisted spin on traditional Team Deathmatch gets even more frantic with this ‚ÄúHyper‚Äù variant. For the uninitiated, Cranked pressures you into chaining kills, eliminating enemy opponents as often as you wish, but within a specific amount of time before a countdown reaches zero, or you‚Äôll explode. Expect a faster reload, weapon swap, and quicker movement speed after your first kill. Points are awarded for every kill, meaning getting kills, staying alive longer, earning more points, and finally claiming victory with your team is the plan in Cranked.
  •  Havoc: The action begins with the Team Deathmatch ruleset in effect, with the first team to reach 75 points awarded the win. However, Killstreaks (except those awarded with a modifier) are disabled, and a variety of match-changing modifiers come into play!
  • Headshots only: This team mode, played on a small moshpit of maps, is for skilled players who can demonstrate impressive aim. Using Team Deathmatch rules, augmented by the fact that only headshots count when eliminating other players; no damage is dealt, and no team score progression is possible unless your cranium-aiming is true. 

Playlist modifers

  • Looping Killstreaks: Streaks reset fully once you reach the upper end of your current streaks, allowing you to earn unlimited streaks in one life.
  • Earning Killstreaks: You receive points added to your streak if you slay an enemy player with your Killstreak, or Assist in killing a player with your Killstreak.
  • Killstreak Cache: When a player is eliminated, they drop a cache containing a percentage of their earned Killstreak progress. Grab the cache and add it to your own progress!

New killstreaks

  •  Intelligent Munitions Systems: The Intelligent Munitions System is loaded with smart explosives that eliminate enemy personnel and vehicles within range. When triggered, it will eject an explosive upwards, which then locks onto its target and propels it towards them.
  • Loitering Munition: An unmanned rocket-equipped drone loiters over the targeted areas. On each activation, the drone selects the targeted location with the largest number of viable targets to bombard with rockets. It can be activated up to three times.
  • Missile Drone: A small, piloted drone controlled by the player that fires guided missiles.
  • DNA Bomb: The discovery of a DNA Bomb Popov Power in Urzikstan is a taste of the tremendous power this brings to a Multiplayer match. The tremendous explosion can be triggered provided you‚Äôve acquired enough consecutive kills without dying. Once you‚Äôre granted the DNA Bomb you can detonate it, eliminating all players on the opposing team. Unlike the MGB, the DNA Bomb does not conclude the match.

New perks and equipment

Compression Plate

Immediately regenerate health after a Primary, Secondary, or Throwing Knife/ Throwing Star kill. Objective captures also trigger health regeneration. An icon appears on your HUD when this Perk is active.

Mission Control Vest

  • Equipment Slots (6): Tactical, Lethal, Field Upgrade, Gloves, Gear (2)
  • Reduces kills required by 1 and score required by 125 for Killstreaks.
  • Earn 1 kill or 125 score for every 2 Kill Assists or Cross Fire Assists

item.title: Try this devious DnD Pact of the Chain Warlock build
item.content:encoded:
https://www.destructoid.com/try-this-devious-dnd-pact-of-the-chain-warlock-build/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=try-this-devious-dnd-pact-of-the-chain-warlock-build

Friendship is magic!

Warlocks are one of the most customizable Dungeons & Dragons classes, with a patron at level 1 and the actual subclass (the all-important Pact) at level 3. While patron choice has a huge impact on the flavor of your warlock, the mechanical meat of this layered and rewarding class lies in your choice of Pact.

I‚Äôve been using this Pact of the Chain build in my own game, and I can thoroughly recommend it! The Pacts all have their own playstyles to recommend them, and the Pact of the Chain might seem underwhelming at first glance, as wizards already get the find familiar spell. However, the warlock familiar is an entirely different animal. Quite literally.

The Pact of the Chain allows the warlock to cast the find familiar spell as any run-of-the-mill wizard can, but while most find familiar spells can only summon a fairly ordinary creature, albeit a magical version, Pact of the Chain warlocks can choose their familiar from imps, pseudodragons, quasits, and sprites instead. My personal favorite is the psuedodragon, for reasons I‚Äôll come to soon.

All familiars have their own initiative and can take a move and an action (such as the Help action to give the caster an advantage on their attacks against that target). Pact of the Chain familiars, unlike other familiars, can be commanded to attack by their pacted warlock, but the warlock must give up their own action to give their familiar an attack on the warlock‚Äôs initiative. Luckily, the Investment of the Chain Master invocation from Tasha‚Äôs Cauldron of Everything, allows you to use your bonus action to attack with your familiar.

The other key part of this build is that the Investment of the Chain Master means that whenever your familiar forces an enemy to make a saving throw, it uses your spell save DC instead of its usual saving throw. This is where the pseudodragon shines compared to the other familiars: its sting attack has very limited damage but forces its victim to make a Constitution saving throw using the warlock‚Äôs spell save DC for the saving throw. If the target fails the saving throw, they become poisoned for an hour, which imposes a disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks, and if they fail by 5 or more, they immediately fall unconscious.

What this means in practice is that the familiar can move within 5 feet of an enemy on its turn and use the help action to give the warlock an advantage on their next attack against the target. The warlock can use their bonus action to command the pseudodragon to attack the target. The warlock then has their own standard action free to make an attack with an advantage on the target from the help action or cast another spell.

This has some potential weaknesses: if the pseudodragon gets taken out (which did happen to my warlock‚Äôs familiar during an early adventure), your combat ability is somewhat hampered, though you still always have your spells. Luckily, Pact of the Chain warlocks can use their reaction to give their familiar resistance to the damage it just took. Look after your familiar and it will look after you!

You can also use any familiar to deliver touch-range spell attacks on your turn with your attack modifier rather than theirs, so you may wish to consider taking the Magic Initiate feat for the Sorcerer and gain the Shocking Grasp cantrip, as Sorcerers use Charisma for their spell attacks.

Warlock Pact of the Chain Build

Attributes: High Charisma (vital for any Warlock ‚Äî put your highest attribute score in Charisma and ideally take a species bonus to Charisma). Other attributes are very much up to you.

Patron: Patrons that provide access to spell attacks such as Scorching Ray from the Fiend or the Genie, or the Tentacle of the Deep from the Fathomless, or touch spells such as Cure Wounds from the Celestial, have slightly better synergy with this build.

Invocations (level 2): Agonizing Blast and another invocation that you will replace at level 3 with Investment of the Chain Master.

Pact (level 3): Pact of the Chain with the pseudodragon.

Spells: Eldritch Blast is the real favorite here, as it is a ranged spell attack that you can use in conjunction with your familiar‚Äôs help action. For your other cantrip, Mind Sliver subtracts 1d4 from the target‚Äôs next saving throw, making them more vulnerable to your pseudodragon‚Äôs poison.

item.title: FFXIV Anima Weapons guide: Every quest, item, and duty required for Heavensward Relic
item.content:encoded:
https://www.destructoid.com/ffxiv-anima-weapons-guide-every-quest-item-and-duty-required-for-heavensward-relic/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=ffxiv-anima-weapons-guide-every-quest-item-and-duty-required-for-heavensward-relic

Anima relic weapons are, arguably, the nicest relic weapons available in Final Fantasy XIV. However, they do take one hell of a grind to acquire, and there are a lot of steps you need to go through in order to get your hands on one. 

That said, there are some things you can do to make life easier for yourself and this far past the Heavensward expansion, during which these relics became available, some of the steps can pretty much be steamrollered relatively quickly. 

To complete your first Anima relic weapon, you‚Äôll need to complete a total of 11 quests. We‚Äôll go over each of these in more detail later, but for now, here‚Äôs the checklist of Anima quests:

  • An Unexpected Proposal
  • Soul Without Life
  • Toughening Up
  • Coming Into Its Own
  • Finding Your Voice
  • A Dream Fulfilled
  • Future Proof
  • Born Again Anima
  • Body and Soul
  • Words of Wisdom
  • Best Friends Forever

Some of these quests are much easier to complete than others, but the overwhelming majority of them come with their own variety of grind. On the plus side, you‚Äôll at least have an epic weapon once you‚Äôve completed the final step. 

If you‚Äôre wanting to work on multiple Anima relics at one time, this is entirely possible. However, you cannot be working on the same quest for multiple relics at the same time, so you‚Äôll need to progress one of the weapons at least one step before starting the grind for another Job.

How to complete An Unexpected Proposal in Final Fantasy XIV

Before you can get to actually beginning your Anima weapon journey, you‚Äôll need to meet a couple of requirements:

  • Complete the level 60 MSQ quest ‚ÄúHeavensward‚Äù
  • Reach at least level 60 on the Job you want to get an Anima relic for

If you‚Äôve done this, head to Idyllshire and go straight to Rowena (X:5.0, Y:5.1). After talking to her, she‚Äôll send you off to Azys Lla, where you‚Äôll need to find and talk to Ardashir (X:7.1, Y:10.9). Ardashir will be your go-to guy for all things Anima related, so you‚Äôll soon get familiar with where to find him. 

How to complete Soul Without Life in Final Fantasy XIV

Relic stage: Animated 

Speak to Ardashir in Azys Lla, and he‚Äôll send you off to Mor Dhona to talk to Rowena. In order to complete the first ‚Äòproper‚Äô Anima weapon quest, you need to get your hands on one Astral Nodule and one Umbral Nodule. You‚Äôve got a choice of which way you go about this. Both options require a bit of a grind, but let‚Äôs look at each option in detail.

Complete FATEs

Before you can get an Astral or Umbral Nodule, you‚Äôll need to gather up six different types of Luminous Crystals. Each Crystal has a corresponding element, and each can be gained through completing FATEs in a specific Heavensward zone. You don‚Äôt need to complete these FATEs as the Job you‚Äôre aiming to get an Anima weapon for.

The Crystals you need to create an Astral Nodule come from the following zones:

The Crystals you need to create an Umbral Nodule come from the following zones:

It‚Äôs worth noting that you need to complete a FATE with a gold rating to be in with a chance of gaining a Crystal and even then, it‚Äôs far from guaranteed. You‚Äôre likely to complete a lot of FATEs before you have all of the Crystals you need. 

Once you‚Äôve gathered all of your elemental Crystals, you can take them to Syndony in Mor Dhona (X:22.5, Y:5.9) and exchange them for the two Nodules. 

Trade in a completed Zodiac Zeta weapon

If you‚Äôve previously been through the mammoth grind required to get a Zodiac Zeta weapon, you do have the option to trade this in for the Astral and Umbral Nodules. To do this, simply talk to Sydony and select the option to trade a Zodiac Zeta weapon.

I know this seems like a massive sacrifice after all of the hard work you put into getting the Zeta weapon, considering you‚Äôll lose the weapon itself, but doing so will allow you to purchase replicas of every Zodiac stage weapon from Drake in North Shroud (X:30.3, Y:20.1). 

You‚Äôre unlikely to be using the weapon itself, as it‚Äôs a level 50 weapon with a low iLvl, so if you‚Äôre only using it as a glamour then this option may be worthwhile to speed through this first step of your Anima weapon. 

Regardless of how you gained your Nodules, once you‚Äôve got them, head back to Azys Lla and hand them over to Ardashir to complete this quest, rewarding you with your Animated Anima weapon and allowing you to pick up the next quest. 

How to complete Toughening Up in Final Fantasy XIV

Relic stage: Awoken

Speak to Ardashir in Azys Lla again to begin the next step in the Anims journey. This stage of the Relic grind requires you to complete a long list of Dungeons with your first-stage relic equipped. Thankfully, the rest of your gear can be any iLvl and you can run the dungeons unsynced, so if you‚Äôre going back to this with a job at level 90, you‚Äôre going to speed through these dungeons without a problem. 

These dungeons come in three ‚Äòwaves‚Äô, with you needing to talk to Ardashir in between the ‚Äòwaves‚Äô in order to update him on your progress. Here‚Äôs the full list of steps needed in order to complete this quest:

  • Complete Snowcloak (Level 50)
  • Complete Sastasha (Hard) (Level 50)
  • Complete The Sunken Temple of Qarn (Hard) (Level 50)
  • Talk to Ardashir in Southern Thanalan (X:25.0, Y:12.1)
  • Complete The Keeper of the Lake (Level 50)
  • Complete The Wanderer‚Äôs Palace (Hard) (Level 50)
  • Complete Amdapor Keep (Hard) (Level 50)
  • Speak to Ardashir in South Shroud (X:24.9, Y:24.1)
  • Complete The Dusk Vigil (Level 51)
  • Complete Sohm Al (Level 53)
  • Complete The Aery (Level 55)
  • Complete the Vault (Level 57)

Once you‚Äôve completed these steps, equip any other weapon for your chosen Job and make sure that your Animated weapon is in your inventory before heading back to Azys Lla. Talk to Ardashir in his usual location to complete this quest and gain the Awoken stage of your Anima relic.

How to complete Coming into Its Own in Final Fantasy XIV

Relic stage: Anima

Talk to Ardashir in Azys Lla and, if this is your first Anima weapon grind, he‚Äôll send you off to Mor Dhona to talk to Cristiana (X:21.4, Y5.4). If this isn‚Äôt your first Anima rodeo, you don‚Äôt need to talk to her again and can simply begin to hand in the items needed, which we‚Äôll get into now. 

To complete this quest, you‚Äôll need to get four things:

  • 1 Enchanted Rubber
  • 1 Fast-drying Carboncoat
  • 1 Divine Water
  • 1 Fast-acting Allagan Catalyst

Unfortunately, getting them is far from simple and this stage is guaranteed to take you a little while, because you need to get multiple other items to trade in for these final ones:

Unidentifiable items

Thankfully, to get your hands on Unidentifiable items, you have a few options; but you‚Äôre unlikely to be able to purchase all of them in one spending spree and you‚Äôre probably going to have to grind at least a few duties to complete the set.

Unidentifiable items can be purchased for 150 Tomestones of Poetics each from Auriana in Mor Dhona (X:22.0, Y:6.0) or Hismena in Idyllshire (X:5.0, Y:5.0). If you‚Äôre wanting to buy all of these Unidentifiable items with Poetics, you‚Äôll need a total of 6,000 Poetics. 

Otherwise, Unidentifiable items can be obtained in the following ways:

Perhaps the easiest and most time effective way to get these items is through completing the required Alexander duties ten times each, especially if you have the option to unsync them at level 90. 

Crafted items

If you don‚Äôt have a required crafting Jobs available to you, don‚Äôt panic. You can still complete this step. These items can also be purchased using Grand Company Seals, but they‚Äôre pretty expensive. Each item costs 5,000 GC Seals, so you‚Äôll need 80,000 Seals in total. Alternatively, if you‚Äôve got the spare Gil, you can purchase all of these items on the Marketboard at varying prices.

If you want to craft these items yourself, here are the recipes:

Once you‚Äôve gathered up this collection of items, you can head back to Cristiana in Mor Dhona and exchange them for the four items you need to complete this quest. Once you‚Äôve got them, make sure the Awoken weapon is in your inventory and go back to Azys Lla. Talk to Gerolt (X:7.0, Y:11.0) to upgrade your weapon to its Anima stage and complete this step. 

How to complete Finding Your Voice in Final Fantasy XIV

Relic stage: Hyperconductive Anima

After the grind of the previous two quests, this one isn‚Äôt actually all that bad, though you will need a rather large pile of Poetics in order to complete it. You‚Äôll also need to complete this quest with the Anima weapon equipped. Switching Jobs will prevent you from proceeding.

After speaking to Ardashir again, you‚Äôll need to get 5 Aether Oils, which can be purchased from Hismena in Idyllshire (X:5.7, Y:5.2). Each Aether Oil costs 350 Tomestones of Poetics, so you‚Äôll need 1,750 Poetics in total. 

And that‚Äôs it for this quest. Once you‚Äôve got the Aether Oils, make sure your Anima weapon is in your inventory and head back to Azys Lla. Talk to Ardashir to finish this quest and pick up your Hyperconductive Anima weapon. 

How to complete A Dream Fulfilled in Final Fantasy XIV

Relic stage: Reconditioned Anima

After talking to Ardashir, head to Idyllshire to meet Ulan (X:6.4, Y:4.7), who will be your main contact during this quest. In order to help you enhance the stats (such as Critical Hit and Determination) of your weapon, Ulan needs two things ‚Äì Umbrite and Crystal Sand ‚Äì which can be combined to create Treated Crystal Sand. You‚Äôll need roughly 60 of each item in order to create the 180 required Treated Crystal Sand.

The first of these items, Umbrite, can only be obtained by purchasing it from Hismena for 75 Tomestones of Poetics each. To get the required 60 Umbrite, you‚Äôll need a total of 4,500 Poetics. 

Crystal Sand, on the other hand, can be obtained through exchanging items with Ulan. Each item (or group of items) can be exchanged for 2 Crystal Sand:

Once you‚Äôve gathered all of the items (or periodically in stages, if that‚Äôs how you want to do it) talk to Ulan to create Treated Crystal Sand. You can then use this Treated Crystal Sand to modify the Stats of your weapon. Once all 180 points have been allocated, make sure your Hyperconductive Anima weapon is in your inventory and return to Azys Lla to talk to Ardashir. This will complete this quest and reward you with a Reconditioned Anima weapon. 

How to complete Future Proof in Final Fantasy XIV

Relic stage: Sharpened Anima

Talk to Ardashir, who will tell you that you need to gather 50 Singing Clusters. This quest is pretty straightforward, and thankfully there are multiple ways to get Singing Clusters. 

The first way is by purchasing them from Hismena in Idyllshire for 40 Tomestones of Poetics each. In order to get all 50 this way, you‚Äôd need 2,000 Poetics. However, to cut the cost (and the grind) there are a couple of quests which can be repeated weekly to gain Singing Clusters:

Once you‚Äôve got all 50 Singing Clusters, deliver them to Blamprest in Idyllshire (X:7.9, Y:6.0), and then return to Ardashir in Azys Lla to receive your Sharpened Anima and complete this quest. 

How to complete Born Again Anima in Final Fantasy XIV

Relic stage: Complete Anima

After talking to Ardashir, he‚Äôll send you off to complete three dungeons. You do not need your Sharpened Anima weapon equipped as you complete these dungeons, but you do need to complete them as the Job which you‚Äôre getting the weapon for:

  • Sohm Al (Hard)
  • The Great Gubal Library (Hard)
  • The Lost City of Amdapor (Hard)

Once you‚Äôve done this, you‚Äôll need to complete a side quest called ‚ÄúSome Assembly Required‚Äù. To do this, you‚Äôll need to collect 15 Pneumite, which can be purchased for either 4,000 GC Seals or 100 Tomestones of Poetics each. Once you‚Äôve done that, we can move on to the main part of this quest ‚Äî Aetheric Density collection. 

Talk to the Verification Node and you‚Äôll be given an Enhanced Anima Glass. You can use this at any time to check the Aetheric Density of your weapon. When you use the Glass, you‚Äôll see a sprite surrounded by 10 glyphs and completing certain duties will reward Aetheric Density, slowly filling these glyphs and making them glow. 

Aetheric Density gathering

Every duty that was introduced as part of the Heavensward expansion rewards Density, as long as it is completed while the Sharpened Anima weapon is equipped, but some offer more than others. Occasionally, you may receive a bonus amount of Density, but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend hoping for this. You‚Äôll need to get a total of 2,000 Density in order to complete this quest. 

Here‚Äôs a quick rundown of all duties and how much Density they offer:

The easiest and quickest way to gather Density is through completing Alexander ‚Äì The Eyes of the Creator (Savage), also called A9S, 21 times (or less if you‚Äôre lucky enough to get a Stalwart bonus).

Once you‚Äôve completed this step, head back to Azys Lla and talk to Gerolt to complete this quest and obtain your Complete Anima weapon. But don‚Äôt celebrate yet. You‚Äôre not finished. Yes, you have the ‚Äòcomplete‚Äô Anima weapon, but there‚Äôs one more stage which turns your weapon into the Lux variant. Does it help if I tell you that you get a cute minion, too?

To unlock the next stage, you have to complete two one-time quests. The first is called ‚ÄúBody and Soul‚Äù, which is pretty straightforward and, when completed, will unlock the quest which allows you to upgrade your weapon to the Lux version. You only have to complete this quest for your first Anima weapon.

The second is ‚ÄúWords of Wisdom‚Äù. You need to complete this quest before you can upgrade to the Lux variant of your first weapon, but on the plus side, you won‚Äôt ever have to do it again. It‚Äôs a simple back and forth quest between Ardashir in Azys Lla and Rowena in Idyllshire. Once completed, you can move on to the final quest.

How to complete Best Friends Forever in Final Fantasy XIV

Relic stage: Lux

After the grind that you‚Äôve already gone through to get here, this will be easy. Speak to Ardashir and he‚Äôll tell you that you need to complete 12 Trials. These 12 Trials come in sets of three and can be completed in any order, but must be completed with your Complete Anima weapon equipped, and the first three must be completed before moving on to the next three, and so on:

Set 1

  • The Bowl of Embers (Hard)
  • The Howling Eye (Hard)
  • The Navel (Hard)

Set 2

  • Thornmarch (Hard)
  • The Whorleater (Hard)
  • The Striking Tree (Hard)
  • The Akh Afah Amphitheatre (Hard)

Set 3

  • Thok ast Thok (Hard)
  • The Limitless Blue (Hard)

Set 4

  • Containment Bay S1T7
  • Containment Bay P1T6
  • Containment Bay Z1T9

Once you‚Äôve completed these Trials with your Complete Anima weapon in hand, head to Hismena in Idyllshire (or any Sundry Splendor) and pick up one bottle of Archaic Enchanted Ink for 500 Tomestones of Poetics. 

With that in your inventory, drag yourself back to Azys Lla for the final time, talk to Ardashir once more, and pick up your very pretty Lux weapon before deciding not to do another relic for a while ‚Äì at least until you‚Äôve mentally blocked out how much of a grind this actually was and another weapon makes you go ‚Äúooh, that‚Äôs pretty‚Äù.

item.title: All WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria rewards (WoW Remix MoP)
item.content:encoded:
https://www.destructoid.com/all-wow-remix-mists-of-pandaria-rewards-wow-remix-mop/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=all-wow-remix-mists-of-pandaria-rewards-wow-remix-mop

The new limited-time World of Warcraft Remix: Mists of Pandaria event adds a ton of rewards for players to grind for as they level up through the over a decade-old expansion. There are a lot of rewards to acquire for those who are into cosmetics including mounts, toys, and ensembles. Here are all of the WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria rewards you can obtain during the WoW Remix MoP limited-time mode.

All WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria rewards

Even though WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria is technically separate from your retail World of Warcraft characters, the rewards you obtain inside of WoW Remix MoP will also carry over to your retail characters as well. There are special vendors setup at various Infinite Bazaar locations throughout Pandaria, with one in every zone. You will need to be on a Timerunning WoW Remix: MoP specific character to see the Infinite Bazaar vendors. Here are the coordinates where you can find all the WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria vendors:

  • Jade Forest: 42.6, 27 by Tian Monastery
  • Kun-Lai Summit: 69.8, 53 by Temple of the White Tiger
  • Townlong Steppes: 38.2, 64 by Niuzao Temple
  • Vale of Eternal Blossoms (Alliance): 60.4, 18.1
  • Vale of Eternal Blossoms (Horde): 60.4, 18.1
  • Valley of the Four Winds: 53.4, 51.2 by Halfhill

In this special mode, any mounts, toys, or cosmetics including transmogs and ensembles will be useable on your main characters once you unlock them. Here are all the obtainable rewards during the WoW Remix MoP event:

AllWoW Remix: MoP Mounts

In total there are 30 new mounts added specifically to the WoW Remix: MoP event for you to obtain, as well as the ability to acquire 13 existing mounts in retail World of Warcraft that are tougher to get. The new event-exclusive mounts costs 2,200, 4,400, and 6,600 Bronze. The existing retail mounts, however, have price points of 18,700, 38,500, and 50,000. These are all 41 mounts you can obtain during in WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria:

AllWoW Remix: MoP Toys

Those interested in collecting Toys in World of Warcraft will be happy to see there are 21 Toys in total that you can purchase with Bronze in WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria. All of these 21 Toys except for one, the Mini Mana Bomb, already exist on retail. However, all of these are obtained via chance and rolls in retail, whereas in WoW Remix: MoP you can acquire them specifically with bronze. Here are all the Toys you can purchase in WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria:

"From the very beginning of Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 we have had you in-mind."

With less than a day until Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 releases, Ninja Theory studio head Dom Matthews has issued a heartfelt statement to fans.

Posted on the official Ninja Theory X account, Matthews shared a touching message to fans, expressing gratitude for their support, along with the development team for working on Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2.

"From the very beginning of Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2, we have had you in mind," Matthews wrote. "And I truly hope that when you play the 2nd chapter of Senua's story, you will find that familiar connection once again, and so many more people will find their way to Senua and her world too."

A message from Studio Head Dom Matthews ahead of our launch tomorrow. pic.twitter.com/IH98qP9evv

‚Äî Ninja Theory (@NinjaTheory) May 20, 2024

Matthews' message points out how many fans have reached out to Ninja Theory to express how important Senua means to them and how much their faith has inspired Ninja Theory to continue her story. Ninja Theory's first chapter in the series, Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice, was released in 2017, and both fans and critics praised it for its visuals, story, and depiction of psychosis, which many have said was the most remarkable thing about the original Hellblade.

"Its incredibly smart use of audio and visual distortion and trickery to convey the frightening effects of psychosis, hallucinations, and delusion, are married with the gameplay elements for an experience that rarely ever grapples over whether it's a game or a story," we wrote in our review of Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice.

During the 2019 Game Awards, Ninja Theory announced that it was working on Hellblade 2. Some fans were disappointed with a few revelations ahead of its release, such as Hellblade 2 not receiving a physical release and the console version being locked at 30 frames per second (FPS).

Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 is out tomorrow on PC and Xbox. For more information, check out IGN's Hellblade 2 preview and our piece on how Ninja Theory has leveraged technology, such as Epic Games' MetaHuman animator technology, to take immersion to the next level.

Season 4 of Modern Warfare 3, Warzone, and Warzone Mobile arrives on May 29, and Activision has revealed the full roadmap of content, with highlights that include new weapons to unlock, more MP maps, and a Gundam crossover.

Season 4 weapons and operators

Four new weapons arrive with Season 4. The Superi 46 submachine gun and Kar98k marksman rifle will be available to unlock in the free tiers of the battle pass, while the Reclaimer 18 shotgun and Sledgehammer melee weapon will arrive with the midseason update.

The paid battle pass includes new operator skins for Johnny "Soap" MacTavish, but it also introduces four new operators. Hammer is a new operator who is an instant unlock with the purchase of the battle pass, Void is unlocked at Sector 16, and Dupe and Copy are two BlackCell operators that are exclusive to the premium BlackCell battle pass bundle. This season's BlackCell operator includes a unique finishing move that copies the enemy's operator skin and equips it for a single life.

Seasonal events

Activision lists several events for Season 4, but some of the information for later events are "redacted," and possibly related to the reveal of Call of Duty 2024.

The season starts with the Critical Countdown event. This event runs from May 29 until June 26, and players will be tasked with collecting DNA samples to earn rewards and uncover the details about Season 4's DNA storyline.

Call of Duty's latest IP crossover is with Gundam, which includes new shop bundles themed around the franchise. The Mobile Suit Gundam Legends event runs from June 5 until June 19, and earning XP during this time will unlock Gundam-themed rewards.

Lasty, two other events are vaguely teased. One doesn't give a date or any details, with all information listed as "most secret," while a second "top secret" event is bookmarked for June 19 until June 26. One of these could be related to the secret collaboration teased on the roadmap, which could be the rumored crossover with Fallout.

Modern Warfare 3

Season 4 introduces three new 6v6 core multiplayer maps. Tokyo and Paris maps arrive at launch, with Tokyo being a nighttime city setting and Paris being a daytime map that gives players a view of the Eiffel Tower. The midseason update will add Incline, which is a snowy outpost in the mountains of Warzone's Urzikstan.

New game modes include Demolition and Hyper Cranked at launch, while a Headshots Only playlist and other new game modes will arrive at launch.

The update also includes new perks and killstreaks. Players can unlock a new Mission Control Vest perk that helps them earn killstreaks faster and a Compression Plate perk to aid in health regeneration. Four new killstreaks include the return of Call of Duty's I.M.S, missile drone, DNA Bomb, as well as the new Loitering Munition streak that allows players to leave an unmanned rocket drone in the sky.

Warzone

While Season 4 doesn't provide any new maps, it does make a change to Urzikstan by adding a mysterious DNA Bomb at Popov Power. The update also teases that the bunkers on the map will be accessible once players discover how to open them.

The gulag will receive four random 1v1 silo variants. Each silo has a slightly different map layout, so players will have a bit of variety when fighting for their second chance.

The update also brings the return of Warzone's Buy Back Royale Solo playlist for Urzikstan. Additional modes are teased as being "redacted," and possibly related to upcoming IP crossovers and the reveal of Call of Duty 2024.

In addition to new daily and weekly challenges, Season 4 introduces new Warzone Reward challenges. This offers five different types of Challenge to complete, with each granting a reward:

  • Economics: These offer rewards in return for looting and spending cash at Buy Stations
  • Contracts: Unlock items for completing different types (and numbers) of contracts
  • Social: Interact with enemy players or aid your team to secure more item rewards
  • Mode: Complete tasks in different game modes across standard battle royale, Plunder, and Resurgence
  • Champion's Quest: Available to a player if the Champion's Quest is active in their game

Other features includes the Polaris RZR vehicle to Urzikstan, loot "Hot Zones," and a redacted weapon that will be revealed at a later date.

Warzone Mobile

Warzone Mobile shares progression with MW3 and Warzone, so the battle pass and BlackCell bundle are available. The game also includes its own special events and new content.

The iconic Crash map from 2007's Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare is joining the game's small selection of multiplayer maps.

Additionally, there is a crash taking place on Verdansk, and players will want to investigate the site of the helicopter crash. The roadmap teases this area will have top-secret cargo, but the area may contain "toxic debris" with unnatural elements.

Rebirth Island will also have toxic elements, with green gas-filled barrels littered around the map. These are flammable, but destroying them will earn players special event points in an upcoming event.

Entertainment company Ard√°n has teamed with IMIRT to create a new pilot program specifically for independent developers based in Ireland.

Dubbed IndieDev 2024, the program will support studios situated in Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland. Successful teams get support of up to ‚Ç¨15,000 (or ¬£15,000, for those in Northern Ireland) to build a prototype of their project.

MultiVersus - aka Warner Smash Bros, or The Game Where Scooby-Doo‚Äôs Velma Punches Batman While LeBron James Decks The Iron Giant - hasn‚Äôt quite returned from its self-imposed exile after ending its open beta last year, but it‚Äôs already adding more Iconic Characters(‚Ñ¢) to its already teetering pile of familiar Licensed IP.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

The free-to-play fighter already had the likes of (take a breath) Looney Tunes like Bugs Bunny, Taz and Marvin the Martian; Rick & Morty (of Rick & Morty); Tom & Jerry (of Tom & Jerry); Scooby-Doo‚Äôs Velma and Shaggy; Adventure Time‚Äôs Finn, Jake and, uh, a random Banana Guard; The Iron Giant‚Äôs Iron Giant; Game of Thrones‚Äô Arya Stark; Steven Universe‚Äôs Steven Universe and Garnet; and even a couple of Gremlins in Gizmo and Stripe. Oh, plus LeBron James - apparently appearing here due to his role in the new Space Jam - and a whole host of DC comics superheroes and villains like Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, Harley Quinn, Black Adam and The Joker, with Mark Hamill returning after an absence from Suicide Squad. Phew.

Warner Bros isn‚Äôt done chucking familiar faces from film and TV on the list, though, revealing that Friday the 13th‚Äôs Jason Voorhees and The Matrix‚Äôs Agent Smith - no Neo, yet - will also be finding their way into the platform fighter when it returns on May 28th. Jason will be in from the word go, while Agent Smith will pop up sometime during MultiVersus‚Äô first season of unlockables, which is titled Puns & Villainy.

I‚Äôm not sure whether to be impressive or exhausted by the sheer number of licensed characters crammed into MultiVersus, but I‚Äôll at least admit that it‚Äôs almost certainly the best shot at doing a Smash Bros-like with recognisable characters since Nintendo threw all their video game stars onto the Nintendo 64 25 years ago. (The less said about PlayStation All-Stars Battle Royale, the better.) Still, it‚Äôs hard not to cast a cynical eye on Warner Bros in particular, given their treatment of other video games and creators in the very recent past.

Misgivings with the publisher aside, I do admire the commitment of developers Player First Games to take almost a full year to bring MultiVersus back, having pulled it from sale and turned off the servers after running an open beta from the summer of 2022 to last June. It was a contentious choice - not least because people had already paid real money to unlock stuff during its open beta - but hopefully the results will speak for themselves, having already impressed with a pretty slick offering in its pre-release form.

We‚Äôve only got about a wait to week before we find out if the wait has finally been worth it, as MultiVersus arrives - with Jason and Agent Smith in tow - in just over a week on May 28th.

item.title: Alleged Cut Modern Warfare 3 2011 Post-Credits Scene Completely Changes Ending To Infinity Ward's Trilogy
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/alleged-cut-modern-warfare-3-2011-post-credits-scene-completely-changes-ending-to-infinity-wards-trilogy/1100-6523582/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

In 2011, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 concluded Infinity Ward's original Modern Warfare trilogy, with Captain Price emerging victorious over the terrorist Vladimir Makarov after a dramatic helicopter crash and rooftop battle. But a newly surfaced post-credits scene allegedly cut from the final product completely recontextualizes the ending to one of the greatest FPS trilogies of all time.

The cut scene is similar to the ending seen in the original game, but takes what is a clear victory in the finished scene and instead adds a layer of tragedy to it. In the original ending, after crashing through a rooftop window and seeing Makarov strangled to death, Captain Price lights up a celebratory cigar as the scene fades to black.

However, a post-credits scene allegedly found within the game's original files that has surfaced online (via Call of Duty modder Vlad Lokitonov on YouTube, with the scene in question restored by yoyo1love) continues to play out the ending. A slumped over Price wakes up to the sound of footsteps, and looks up to see a mysterious stranger off in the distance. The man briefly surveys Price's work and then turns around to leave. As he walks away, Price slumps over, his lit cigar falling from his hand and rolling away. The camera fades to black before an old image of his fallen comrades appears on screen.

In this ending, Price to succumbs to his wounds and dies from his encounter with Makarov. The identity of the unknown man who appears is said to be labeled as "shadowman" or "ominous stranger" in the game's files. His true identity will likely remain a mystery, but some fans have interpreted the stranger as representing death, having come to finally claim Price.

Had this cut post-credits scene made its way into the final game, it would have given a much different tone and ending to Infinity Ward's original Modern Warfare trilogy, with its hero dying in the end. With that in mind, it's easy to see why Infinity Ward maybe didn't want to end the trilogy on a bittersweet note, and instead opted to more definitively leave open the possibility of Price returning in a potential sequel.

That is, of course, if this cut ending is legitimate. As of now, it's impossible to know if this ending was actually found tucked away in the game's files for more than a decade or if this is a fan creation. Either way, it does add an interesting wrinkle to what would otherwise be a fairly standard ending to one of the greatest game trilogies ever made.

Infinity Ward is currently retelling and reimagining the story of its original Modern Warfare trilogy in last year's Modern Warfare III. Microsoft, which now owns Activision and its various studios, including Infinity Ward, will reportedly be adding the next installment in the Call of Duty franchise to Game Pass later this year. The game, which has not yet been officially unveiled, is rumored to be a new entry in the Black Ops subseries.

item.title: Wuthering Waves ‚Äì All Confirmed 1.0 Launch Rewards

The official launch of Wuthering Waves is finally upon us, and with it, comes a whole slew of rewards you‚Äôll get for playing the release. If you‚Äôre curious about what kinds of goodies you‚Äôll be getting, here‚Äôs a list of all the confirmed rewards for the 1.0 launch.

All Official Wuthering Waves Launch Rewards for 1.0

The following set of rewards are what you‚Äôll have access to once you load up the game for the first time. Some of the rewards will take a bit of time to unlock, but are available nonetheless. I‚Äôll provide a bit of context for each as well, in case you‚Äôre out of the loop.

Five-Star Character Selector

Players will have the opportunity to choose which of the five-star standard characters they wish to guarantee when starting Wuthering Waves. The way this works is a bit strange, but stick with me and you‚Äôll get it. First, you‚Äôll need to pull a random five-star character from the Beginner‚Äôs Banner to access the selector. From here, you‚Äôll be given the option to select which five-star you want to focus on.

However, the selected character is not given for free, so you‚Äôll potentially still need to reach the pity to get your selected character. This is more like selecting which character banner you want to focus on, rather than selecting the character itself. Even so, this is a fantastic launch reward as it means that most people will have at least one five-star character of their choice and two five-stars overall, on day one.

20 Pulls Milestone Reward

Thanks to the combined effort of the entire global community around Wuthering Waves, all players, regardless of whether you are pre-registered or not, will be getting 20 free banner pulls right at release. This is huge, as it means we‚Äôre all that much closer to getting a five-star character. This addition comes as the milestone reward for Wuthering Waves reaching 30 million pre-registrations, an absolutely colossal number that proves that there‚Äôs a ton of interest and hype surrounding the game.

Four-Star Weapon Selector

All players will be given the ability to select their four-star weapon of choice at the launch of Wuthering Waves. While we don‚Äôt know the hard specifics of when exactly we‚Äôll be able to make the selection, expect it to be very soon after getting started in the game, as four-star weapons are not exactly premium items like five-star weapons are. Personally, I‚Äôm planning to use my four-star selector on a gauntlet weapon type, as I‚Äôm planning to choose Jianxin as my five-star character of choice.

200 Astrite

In addition to all of the above, players will be getting a bit of extra help when it comes to pulling in the form of 200 Astrite. If you‚Äôre not aware of what Astrite is, it is the premium currency you‚Äôll be actively hunting the game world for, for extra pulls on premium banners. Even though 200 is not much, it is still a nice addition considering everything else we‚Äôre all getting.

40 Pulls from Union Levels

Though technically not a launch reward, I figured it would be important to include this tidbit of information for those planning to use their pulls strategically. Your account level in Wuthering Waves is called Union Level, and as you progress through the game, locating chests, completing quests, and exploring the world, your Union Level will increase over time.

At certain points, you‚Äôll get access to additional Pulls for a total count of 40 Pulls upon reaching the max level. This undoubtedly going to take some time to accomplish as, like all gacha games, account progression is time-gated by a Stamina system. So, don‚Äôt expect to get all 40 of these pulls right at release.

A 5-Star Weapon Selector from Union Level

All players can expect to have at least one five-star weapon on their account via the free five-star weapon selector obtained through Union Level progression. This was actually available in the final CBT2 test for Wuthering Waves, and was obtainable at either Union Level 35 or 45 (I don‚Äôt recall which). Despite this, I fully expect this selector to obtained around the same Union Level. If it is, then know that it will take a week or two to reach this reward.

20 more Pulls from Appreciation of Support
